info.title: Azure Container Registry
info.description: Metadata API definition for the Azure Container Registry runtime

get.description:
Retrieve status of upload identified by uuid. The primary purpose of this
endpoint is to resolve the current status of a resumable upload.

parameters.name: nextBlobUuidLink
parameters.description:
Link acquired from upload start or previous chunk. Note, do not include initial
/ (must do substring(1) )

204.description: There is no content to send for this request, but the headers may be useful.

Range.description: Range indicating the current progress of the upload.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

put.description:
Complete the upload, providing all the data in the body, if necessary. A
request without a body will just complete the upload with previously uploaded
content.

parameters.name: digest
parameters.description: Digest of a BLOB

parameters.name: nextBlobUuidLink
parameters.description:
Link acquired from upload start or previous chunk. Note, do not include initial
/ (must do substring(1) )

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: Optional raw data of blob

201.description: The request has succeeded and a new resource has been created as a result.

Docker-Content-Digest.description: Digest of the targeted content for the request.

Range.description: Range indicating the current progress of the upload.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

patch.description: Upload a stream of data without completing the upload.

parameters.name: nextBlobUuidLink
parameters.description:
Link acquired from upload start or previous chunk. Note, do not include initial
/ (must do substring(1) )

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: Raw data of blob

202.description: The request has been accepted for processing, but processing has not yet completed.

Docker-Upload-UUID.description: Identifies the docker upload uuid for the current request.

Range.description: Range indicating the current progress of the upload.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

delete.description:
Cancel outstanding upload processes, releasing associated resources. If this is
not called, the unfinished uploads will eventually timeout.

parameters.name: nextBlobUuidLink
parameters.description:
Link acquired from upload start or previous chunk. Note, do not include initial
/ (must do substring(1) )

204.description: There is no content to send for this request, but the headers may be useful.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the image (including the namespace)

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

post.description: Exchange AAD tokens for an ACR refresh Token

parameters.name: grantType
parameters.description:
Can take a value of access_token_refresh_token, or access_token, or
refresh_token

values.name: access_token_refresh_token
values.description: Grant type for exchanging both access token and refresh token

values.name: access_token
values.description: Grant type for exchanging access token only

values.name: refresh_token
values.description: Grant type for exchanging refresh token only

parameters.name: service
parameters.description: Indicates the name of your Azure container registry.

parameters.name: tenant
parameters.description: AAD tenant associated to the AAD credentials.

parameters.name: refreshToken
parameters.description:
AAD refresh token, mandatory when grant_type is access_token_refresh_token or
refresh_token

parameters.name: accessToken
parameters.description:
AAD access token, mandatory when grant_type is access_token_refresh_token or
access_token.

get.description: Exchange Username, Password and Scope for an ACR Access Token

parameters.name: service
parameters.description: Indicates the name of your Azure container registry.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description:
Expected to be a valid scope, and can be specified more than once for multiple
scope requests. You can obtain this from the Www-Authenticate response header
from the challenge.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

post.description: Exchange ACR Refresh token for an ACR Access Token

parameters.name: grantType
parameters.description:
Can take a value of access_token_refresh_token, or access_token, or
refresh_token

values.name: access_token_refresh_token
values.description: Grant type for exchanging both access token and refresh token

values.name: access_token
values.description: Grant type for exchanging access token only

values.name: refresh_token
values.description: Grant type for exchanging refresh token only

parameters.name: service
parameters.description: Indicates the name of your Azure container registry.

parameters.name: tenant
parameters.description: AAD tenant associated to the AAD credentials.

parameters.name: refreshToken
parameters.description:
AAD refresh token, mandatory when grant_type is access_token_refresh_token or
refresh_token

parameters.name: accessToken
parameters.description:
AAD access token, mandatory when grant_type is access_token_refresh_token or
access_token.

get.description: Retrieve the blob from the registry identified by digest.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the image (including the namespace)

parameters.name: digest
parameters.description: Digest of a BLOB

Content-Length.description: The length of the requested blob content.

Docker-Content-Digest.description: Digest of the targeted content for the request.

Location.description: The location where the layer should be accessible.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the image (including the namespace)

parameters.name: digest
parameters.description: Digest of a BLOB

202.description: The request has been accepted for processing, but processing has not yet completed.

Docker-Content-Digest.description: Digest of the targeted content for the request.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

head.description: Same as GET, except only the headers are returned.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the image (including the namespace)

parameters.name: digest
parameters.description: Digest of a BLOB

Content-Length.description: The length of the requested blob content.

Docker-Content-Digest.description: Digest of the targeted content for the request.

Location.description: The location where the layer should be accessible.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

post.description: Mount a blob identified by the `mount` parameter from another repository.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the image (including the namespace)

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Name of the source repository.

parameters.name: mount
parameters.description: Digest of blob to mount from the source repository.

201.description: The request has succeeded and a new resource has been created as a result.

Docker-Content-Digest.description: Digest of the targeted content for the request.

Docker-Upload-UUID.description: Identifies the docker upload uuid for the current request.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

get.description:
Get the manifest identified by `name` and `reference` where `reference` can be
a tag or digest.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the image (including the namespace)

parameters.name: reference
parameters.description: A tag or a digest, pointing to a specific image

parameters.name: accept
parameters.description:
Accept header string delimited by comma. For example,
application/vnd.docker.distribution.manifest.v2+json

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

put.description:
Put the manifest identified by `name` and `reference` where `reference` can be
a tag or digest.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the image (including the namespace)

parameters.name: reference
parameters.description: A tag or a digest, pointing to a specific image

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: Manifest body, can take v1 or v2 values depending on accept header

201.description: The request has succeeded and a new resource has been created as a result.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

delete.description:
Delete the manifest identified by `name` and `reference`. Note that a manifest
can _only_ be deleted by `digest`.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the image (including the namespace)

parameters.name: reference
parameters.description: Digest of a BLOB

202.description: The request has been accepted for processing, but processing has not yet completed.

404.description: The server cannot find the requested resource.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

get.description: Tells whether this Docker Registry instance supports Docker Registry HTTP API v2

204.description: There is no content to send for this request, but the headers may be useful.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

get.description:
Retrieve the blob from the registry identified by `digest`. This endpoint may
also support RFC7233 compliant range requests. Support can be detected by
issuing a HEAD request. If the header `Accept-Range: bytes` is returned, range
requests can be used to fetch partial content.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the image (including the namespace)

parameters.name: digest
parameters.description: Digest of a BLOB

parameters.name: range
parameters.description: Format : bytes=<start>-<end>,  HTTP Range header specifying blob chunk.

Content-Length.description: The length of the requested blob content.

Content-Range.description: Content range of the blob chunk.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

head.description: Same as GET, except only the headers are returned.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the image (including the namespace)

parameters.name: digest
parameters.description: Digest of a BLOB

parameters.name: range
parameters.description: Format : bytes=<start>-<end>,  HTTP Range header specifying blob chunk.

Content-Length.description: The length of the requested blob content.

Content-Range.description: Content range of the blob chunk.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

post.description: Initiate a resumable blob upload with an empty request body.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the image (including the namespace)

202.description: The request has been accepted for processing, but processing has not yet completed.

Docker-Upload-UUID.description: Identifies the docker upload uuid for the current request.

Range.description: Range indicating the current progress of the upload.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

AcrAccessToken.description: The ACR access token response containing the access token for authentication.

access_token.description: The access token for performing authenticated requests

AcrErrors.description: Acr error response describing why the operation failed

registry.description:
Registry login server name. This is likely to be similar to
{registry-name}.azurecr.io.

link.description: Link to the next page of results

AcrRefreshToken.description: The ACR refresh token response containing the refresh token for authentication.

refresh_token.description: The refresh token to be used for generating access tokens

Annotations.description: Additional information provided through arbitrary metadata.

org.opencontainers.image.created.description:
Date and time on which the image was built (string, date-time as defined by
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6)

org.opencontainers.image.authors.description: Contact details of the people or organization responsible for the image.

org.opencontainers.image.url.description: URL to find more information on the image.

org.opencontainers.image.documentation.description: URL to get documentation on the image.

org.opencontainers.image.source.description: URL to get source code for building the image.

org.opencontainers.image.version.description:
Version of the packaged software. The version MAY match a label or tag in the
source code repository, may also be Semantic versioning-compatible

org.opencontainers.image.revision.description: Source control revision identifier for the packaged software.

org.opencontainers.image.vendor.description: Name of the distributing entity, organization or individual.

org.opencontainers.image.licenses.description:
License(s) under which contained software is distributed as an SPDX License
Expression.

org.opencontainers.image.ref.name.description: Name of the reference for a target.

org.opencontainers.image.description.description: Human-readable description of the software packaged in the image

ArtifactManifestOrder.description: Sort options for ordering manifests in a collection.

values.name: None
values.description: Do not provide an orderby value in the request.

values.name: LastUpdatedOnDescending
values.description:
Order manifests by LastUpdatedOn field, from most recently updated to least
recently updated.

values.name: LastUpdatedOnAscending
values.description:
Order manifest by LastUpdatedOn field, from least recently updated to most
recently updated.

ArtifactManifestPlatform.description: The artifact's platform, consisting of operating system and architecture.

registry.description:
Registry login server name. This is likely to be similar to
{registry-name}.azurecr.io.

ArtifactTagOrder.description: Sort options for ordering tags in a collection.

values.name: None
values.description: Do not provide an orderby value in the request.

values.name: LastUpdatedOnDescending
values.description:
Order tags by LastUpdatedOn field, from most recently updated to least recently
updated.

values.name: LastUpdatedOnAscending
values.description:
Order tags by LastUpdatedOn field, from least recently updated to most recently
updated.

registry.description:
Registry login server name. This is likely to be similar to
{registry-name}.azurecr.io.

code.description: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

message.description: A human-readable representation of the error.

details.description: An array of details about specific errors that led to this reported error.

innererror.description: An object containing more specific information than the current object about the error.

Azure.Core.Foundations.InnerError.description: An object containing more specific information about the error. As per Azure REST API guidelines - https://aka.ms/AzureRestApiGuidelines#handling-errors.

code.description: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

registry.description:
Registry login server name. This is likely to be similar to
{registry-name}.azurecr.io.

Descriptor.description: Docker V2 image layer descriptor including config and layers

urls.description: Specifies a list of URIs from which this object may be downloaded.

annotations.description: Additional information provided through arbitrary metadata.

History.description: A list of unstructured historical data for v1 compatibility

signature.description: A signature for the image manifest, signed by a libtrust private key

alg.description: The algorithm used to sign or encrypt the JWT

references.description:
List of artifacts that are referenced by this manifest list, with information
about the platform each supports.  This list will be empty if this is a leaf
manifest and not a manifest list.

ManifestList.description: Returns the requested Docker multi-arch-manifest file

manifests.description: List of V2 image layer information

ManifestListAttributes.description: Attributes of a manifest in a manifest list.

mediaType.description:
The MIME type of the referenced object. This will generally be
application/vnd.docker.image.manifest.v2+json, but it could also be
application/vnd.docker.image.manifest.v1+json

size.description: The size in bytes of the object

digest.description: The digest of the content, as defined by the Registry V2 HTTP API Specification

platform.description:
The platform object describes the platform which the image in the manifest runs
on. A full list of valid operating system and architecture values are listed in
the Go language documentation for $GOOS and $GOARCH

manifests.description: (ManifestList, OCIIndex) List of V2 image layer information

layers.description: (V2, OCI) List of V2 image layer information

OCIIndex.description: Returns the requested OCI index file

manifests.description: List of OCI image layer information

annotations.description: Additional information provided through arbitrary metadata.

OCIManifest.description: Returns the requested OCI Manifest file

layers.description: List of V2 image layer information

annotations.description: Additional information provided through arbitrary metadata.

grantType.description:
Can take a value of access_token_refresh_token, or access_token, or
refresh_token

service.description: Indicates the name of your Azure container registry.

tenant.description: AAD tenant associated to the AAD credentials.

acrRefreshToken.description:
AAD refresh token, mandatory when grant_type is access_token_refresh_token or
refresh_token

accessToken.description:
AAD access token, mandatory when grant_type is access_token_refresh_token or
access_token.

service.description: Indicates the name of your Azure container registry.

scope.description:
Which is expected to be a valid scope, and can be specified more than once for
multiple scope requests. You obtained this from the Www-Authenticate response
header from the challenge.

refreshToken.description: Must be a valid ACR refresh token

grantType.description: Grant type is expected to be refresh_token

Platform.description:
The platform object describes the platform which the image in the manifest runs
on. A full list of valid operating system and architecture values are listed in
the Go language documentation for $GOOS and $GOARCH

architecture.description: Specifies the CPU architecture, for example amd64 or ppc64le.

os.description: The os field specifies the operating system, for example linux or windows.

os.version.description:
The optional os.version field specifies the operating system version, for
example 10.0.10586.

os.features.description:
The optional os.features field specifies an array of strings, each listing a
required OS feature (for example on Windows win32k

variant.description:
The optional variant field specifies a variant of the CPU, for example armv6l
to specify a particular CPU variant of the ARM CPU.

features.description:
The optional features field specifies an array of strings, each listing a
required CPU feature (for example sse4 or aes

link.description: Link to the next page of results

TokenGrantType.description: Grant type is expected to be refresh_token

V2Manifest.description: Returns the requested Docker V2 Manifest file
